alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 26 at 2:43PM CST until January 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog and freezing fog, affecting the area to varying degrees. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central and south central Nebraska, including the Tri Cities. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous, and freezing fog could deposit a thin layer of ice on untreated roads and bridges, making them slick. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions will likely vary across the Advisory area, with fog worsening in some areas before others tonight, and also improving in some areas before others Saturday morning. However, at some point most places should see visibility drop to around 1/4 mile or less. Even if truly dense fog fails to develop, even lighter freezing fog could cause slick spots on untreated roads and bridges.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
